turns.utterance: Hi, do you like to camp? they call children "campers" at my summer camp.
turns.response: I never have liked camp. I had some bad experiences as a kid but I know many kids love them.

turns.utterance: Well camp is supervised by adults. Were you scared to be by yourself?
turns.response: I think during one experience that was probably it. Other times were food poisoning and severe sun burns.

turns.utterance: oh boy that's not good. it's a good thing your school didn't make you do it. sometime they do if  you did not complete the required curriculum.
turns.response: I didn't know schools could make students go to camp. I always understood it as parents wanting the kids out of the house, haha

turns.utterance: Yeah, and lots of camps now have things like performing arts, music, magic, computer programming, language learning, mathematics, children with special needs, and even weight loss
turns.response: oh, yeah, I guess that makes sense. I wonder how a camp would work around language learning, could be intense if they required you to speak a different language!

phrase: that didnt have anything to do with school.
its a good thing your school didnt make you do it.
